intro: Secamone platystigma, commonly known as the broad-stemmed secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. Secamone platystigma is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
